extracted_data.full_text:
Patient ID: P789024 
Name: Neha Verma 
Age: 32 
Gender: Female 
Date of Visit: 2024-08-21 

Symptoms: 
- Severe abdominal pain (lower right quadrant) 
- Nausea and vomiting 
- Low-grade fever (100.2°F) 
- Loss of appetite 

Medical History: 
- No known chronic illnesses 
- No previous abdominal surgeries 
- Non-smoker, occasional alcohol use 

Medications: 
- Paracetamol (self-administered before visit) 

Preliminary Diagnosis: 
- Suspected Acute Appendicitis 

Recommended Tests: 
- Abdominal Ultrasound 
- CBC with differential 
- Urinalysis 

Physician Notes: 
Pain is localized to the lower right abdomen and worsens with movement. Rebound tenderness 
noted on palpation. High suspicion of acute appendicitis—advised imaging and potential 
surgical consultation. 

Signed, 
Dr. Rajat Mehta 
CityCare General Hospital
